that created this core module cache.\n    56    if (cacheData.getSizeInBytes() < sizeof(uint64_t))\n    57        return SLANG_FAIL;\n    58    auto cacheTimestamp = *(uint64_t*)(cacheData.getData());\n    59    if (cacheTimestamp != currentLibTimestamp)\n    60        return SLANG_FAIL;\n    61    SLANG_RETURN_ON_FAIL(globalSession->loadBuiltinModule(\n    62 68// Attempt to load a precompiled builtin module from slang-xxx-module.dll.\n    69SlangResult tryLoadBuiltinModuleFromDLL(\n    70    slang::IGlobalSession* globalSession,\n    71 \"-module\";\n    75\n    76    Slang::SharedLibrary::Handle libHandle = nullptr;\n    77\n    78    SLANG_RETURN_ON_FAIL(Slang::SharedLibrary::load(moduleFileName.getBuffer(), libHandle));\n    79 dllTimestamp);\n   195            }\n   196        }\n   197        if (SLANG_FAILED(loadFromCacheResult))\n   198        {\n   199            SLANG_RETURN_ON_FAIL(\n   200                globalSession->compileBuiltinModule(slang::BuiltinModuleName::GLSL, 0));\n   201\n   202            // Store the compiled core module to cache file.\n   203            trySaveBuiltinModuleToCache(\n 119{\n   120    None,\n   121    Text,\n   122    Binary,\n   123};\n   124\n   125// When storing the layout for a matrix-type\n   126// value, we need to know whether it has been\n   127// laid out with row-major or column-major\n   128// storage.\n   129//\n   130enum MatrixLayoutMode : SlangMatrixLayoutModeIntegral\n   131{\n   132    kMatrixLayoutMode_RowMajor = 163};\n   164\n   165struct CodeGenContext;\n   166class EndToEndCompileRequest;\n   167class FrontEndCompileRequest;\n   168class Linkage;\n   169class Module;\n   170class TranslationUnitRequest;\n firstSpecializationParamIndex = 0;\n   177    Int specializationParamCount = 0;\n   178};\n   179\n   180/// A request for the front-end to find and validate an entry-point function\n   181struct FrontEndEntryPointRequest : RefObject\n   182{\n   183public:\n   184    /// Create a request for an entry point.\n   185    FrontEndEntryPointRequest(\n   186        FrontEndCompileRequest* compileRequest,\n   187        int translationUnitIndex,\n   188        Name* name,\n   189        Profile profile);\n   190\n   191    /// Get the parent front-end compile request.\n   192    FrontEndCompileRequest* getCompileRequest() { return m_compileRequest; }\n   193\n   194    /// Get the translation unit that contains the entry point.\n   195    TranslationUnitRequest* getTranslationUnit();\n   196\n   197    /// Get the name of the entry point to find.\n   198    Name* getName() { return m_name; }\n   199\n   200    /// Get the stage that the entry point is to be compiled for\n   201    Stage getStage() { return m_profile.getStage(); }\n   202\n   203    /// Get the profile that the entry point is to be compiled for\n   204    Profile getProfile() { return m_profile; }\n   205\n   206    /// Get the index to the translation unit\n   207    int getTranslationUnitIndex() const { return m_translationUnitIndex; }\n   208\n   209private:\n   210    // The parent compile request\n   211    FrontEndCompileRequest* m_compileRequest;\n   212\n   213    // The index of the translation unit that will hold the entry point\n   214    int m_translationUnitIndex;\n   215\n   216    // The name of the entry point function to look for\n   217    Name* m_name;\n   218\n   219    // The profile to compile for (including stage)\n   220    Profile m_profile;\n   221};\n   222\n   223/// Tracks an ordered list of modules that something depends on.\n   224/// TODO: Shader caching currently relies on this being in well defined order.\n   225struct ModuleDependencyList\n   226{\n   227public:\n   228    /// Get the list of modules that are depended on.\n   229    List<Module*> const& getModuleList() { return m_moduleList; }\n   230\n   231    /// Add a module and everything it depends on to the list.\n   232    void addDependency(Module* module);\n   233\n   234    /// Add a module to the list, but not the modules it depends on.\n   235    void addLeafDependency(Module* module);\n   236\n   237private:\n   238    void _addDependency(Module* module);\n   239\n   240    List<Module*> m_moduleList;\n   241    HashSet<Module*> m_moduleSet;\n   242};\n   243\n   244/// Tracks an unordered list of source files that something depends on\n   245/// TODO: Shader caching currently relies on this being in well defined order.\n   246struct FileDependencyList\n   247{\n   248public:\n   249    /// Get the list of files that are depended on.\n   250    List<SourceFile*> const& getFileList() { return m_fileList; }\n   251\n   252    /// Add a file to the list, if it is not already present\n   253    void addDependency(SourceFile* sourceFile);\n   254\n   255    /// Add all of the paths that `module` depends on to the list\n   256    void addDependency(Module* module);\n   257\n   258    void clear()\n   259    {\n   260        m_fileList.clear();\n   261        m_fileSet.clear();\n   262    }\n   263\n   264private:\n   265    // TODO: We are using a `HashSet` here to deduplicate\n   266    // the paths so that we don't return the same path\n   267    // multiple times from `getFilePathList`, but because\n   268    // order isn't important, we could potentially do better\n   269    // in terms of memory (at some cost in performance) by\n   270    // just sorting the `m_fileList` every once in\n   271    // a while and then deduplicating.\n   272\n   273    List<SourceFile*> m_fileList;\n   274    HashSet<SourceFile*> m_fileSet;\n   275};\n   276\n   277\n   278class EntryPoint;\n   279\n   280class ComponentType;\n   281class ComponentTypeVisitor;\n   282\n   283/// Base class for \"component types\" that represent the pieces a final\n   284/// shader program gets linked together from.\n List<SourceFile*> const& getFileDependencies() = 0;\n   475\n   476    /// Callback for use with `enumerateIRModules`\n   477    typedef void (*EnumerateIRModulesCallback)(IRModule* irModule, void* userData);\n   478\n   479    /// Invoke `callback` on all the IR modules that are (transitively) linked into this component\n   480    /// type.\n   481    void enumerateIRModules(EnumerateIRModulesCallback callback, void* userData);\n   482\n   483    /// Invoke `callback` on all the IR modules that are (transitively) linked into this component\n   484    /// type.\n   485    template<typename F>\n   486    void enumerateIRModules(F const& callback)\n   487    {\n   488        struct Helper\n   489        {\n   490            static void helper(IRModule* irModule, void* userData) { (*(F*)userData)(irModule); }\n   491        };\n   492        enumerateIRModules(&Helper::helper, (void*)&callback);\n   493    }\n   494\n   495    /// (transitively) linked into this component\n   499    /// type.\n   500    void enumerateModules(EnumerateModulesCallback callback, void* userData);\n   501\n   502    /// Invoke `callback` on all the modules that are (transitively) linked into this component\n   503    /// type.\n   504    template<typename F>\n   505    void enumerateModules(F const& callback)\n   506    {\n   507        struct Helper\n   508        {\n   509            static void helper(Module* module, void* userData) { (*(F*)userData)(module); }\n   510        };\n   511        enumerateModules(&Helper::helper, (void*)&callback);\n   512    }\n   513\n   514    /// Side-band information generated when specializing this component type.\n   515    ///\n   516    /// Difference subclasses of `ComponentType` are expected to create their\n   517    /// own subclass of `SpecializationInfo` as the output of `_validateSpecializationArgs`.\n   518    /// Later, whenever we want to use a specialized component type we will\n   519    /// also have the `SpecializationInfo` available and will expect it to\n   520    /// have the correct (subclass-specific) type.\n   521    ///\n   522    class SpecializationInfo : public RefObject\n   523    {\n   524    };\n   525\n   526    /// Validate the given specialization `args` and compute any side-band specialization info.\n   527    ///\n   528    /// Any errors will be reported to `sink`, which can thus be used to test\n   529    /// if the operation was successful.\n   530    ///\n   531    /// A null return value is allowed, since not all subclasses require\n   532    /// custom side-band specialization information.\n   533    ///\n   534    /// This function is an implementation detail of `specialize()`.\n   535    ///\n   536    virtual RefPtr<SpecializationInfo> _validateSpecializationArgsImpl(\n   537        SpecializationArg const* args,\n   538        Index argCount,\n   539        DiagnosticSink* sink) = 0;\n   540\n   541    /// Validate the given specialization `args` and compute any side-band specialization info.\n   542    ///\n   543    /// Any errors will be reported to `sink`, which can thus be used to test\n   544    /// if the operation was successful.\n   545    ///\n   546    /// A null return value is allowed, since not all subclasses require\n   547    /// custom side-band specialization information.\n   548    ///\n   549    /// This function is an implementation detail of `specialize()`.\n   550    ///\n   551    RefPtr<SpecializationInfo> _validateSpecializationArgs(\n   552        SpecializationArg const* args,\n   553        Index argCount,\n   554        DiagnosticSink* sink)\n   555    {\n   556        if (argCount == 0)\n   557            return nullptr;\n   558        return _validateSpecializationArgsImpl(args, argCount, sink);\n   559    }\n   560\n   561    /// Specialize this component type given `specializationArgs`\n   562    ///\n   563    /// Any diagnostics will be reported to `sink`, which can be used\n   564    /// to determine if the operation was successful. It is allowed\n   565    /// for this operation to have a non-null return even when an\n   566    /// error is ecnountered.\n   567    ///\n   568    RefPtr<ComponentType> specialize(\n   569        SpecializationArg const* specializationArgs,\n   570        SlangInt specializationArgCount,\n   571        DiagnosticSink* sink);\n   572\n   573    /// Invoke `visitor` on this component type, using the appropriate dynamic type.\n   574    ///\n   575    /// This function implements the \"visitor pattern\" for `ComponentType`.\n   576    ///\n   577    /// If the `specializationInfo` argument is non-null, it must be specialization\n   578    /// information generated for this specific component type by `_validateSpecializationArgs`.\n   579    /// In that case, appropriately-typed specialization information will be passed\n   580    /// when invoking the `visitor`.\n   581    ///\n   582    virtual void acceptVisitor(\n   583        ComponentTypeVisitor* visitor,\n   584        SpecializationInfo* specializationInfo) = 0;\n   585\n   586    /// Create a scope suitable for looking up names or parsing specialization arguments.\n   587    ///\n   588    /// This facility is only needed to support legacy APIs for string-based lookup\n   589    /// and parsing via Slang reflection, and is not recommended for future APIs to use.\n   590    ///\n   591    Scope* _getOrCreateScopeForLegacyLookup(ASTBuilder* astBuilder);\n   592\n   593protected:\n   594    ComponentType(Linkage* linkage);\n   595\n   596protected:\n   597    Linkage* m_linkage;\n   598\n   599    CompilerOptionSet m_optionSet;\n   600\n   601    // Cache of target-specific programs for each target.\n   602    Dictionary<TargetRequest*, RefPtr<TargetProgram>> m_targetPrograms;\n   603\n   604    // Any types looked up dynamically using `getTypeFromString`\n   605    //\n   606    // TODO: Remove this. Type lookup should only be supported on `Module`s.\n   607    //\n   608    Dictionary<String, Type*> m_types;\n   609\n   610    // Any decls looked up dynamically using `findDeclFromString`.\n   611    Dictionary<String, Expr*> m_decls;\n   612\n   613    Scope* m_lookupScope = nullptr;\n   614    std::unique_ptr<Dictionary<String, IntVal*>> m_mapMangledNameToIntVal;\n   615\n   616    Dictionary<Int, ComPtr<IArtifact>> m_targetArtifacts;\n   617};\n   618\n   619/// A component type built up from other component types.\n   620class CompositeComponentType : public ComponentType\n   621{\n   622public:\n   623    static RefPtr<ComponentType> create(\n   624        Linkage* linkage,\n   625        List<RefPtr<ComponentType>> const& childComponents);\n   626\n   627    virtual void buildHash(DigestBuilder<SHA1>& builder) SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   628\n   629    List<RefPtr<ComponentType>> const& getChildComponents() { return m_childComponents; };\n   630    Index getChildComponentCount() { return m_childComponents.getCount(); }\n   631    RefPtr<ComponentType> getChildComponent(Index index) { return m_childComponents[index]; }\n   632\n   633    Index getEntryPointCount() SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   634    RefPtr<EntryPoint> getEntryPoint(Index index) SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   635    String getEntryPointMangledName(Index index) SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   636    String getEntryPointNameOverride(Index index) SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   637\n   638    Index getShaderParamCount() SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   639    ShaderParamInfo getShaderParam(Index index) SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   640\n   641    SLANG_NO_THROW Index SLANG_MCALL getSpecializationParamCount() SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   642    SpecializationParam const& getSpecializationParam(Index index) SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   643\n   644    Index getRequirementCount() SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   645    RefPtr<ComponentType> getRequirement(Index index) SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   646\n   647    List<Module*> const& getModuleDependencies() SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   648    List<SourceFile*> const& getFileDependencies() SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   649\n   650    class CompositeSpecializationInfo : public SpecializationInfo\n   651    {\n   652    public:\n   653        List<RefPtr<SpecializationInfo>> childInfos;\n   654    };\n   655\n   656protected:\n   657    void acceptVisitor(ComponentTypeVisitor* visitor, SpecializationInfo* specializationInfo)\n   658        SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   659\n   660\n   661    RefPtr<SpecializationInfo> _validateSpecializationArgsImpl(\n   662        SpecializationArg const* args,\n   663        Index argCount,\n   664        DiagnosticSink* sink) SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   665\n   666public:\n   667    CompositeComponentType(Linkage* linkage, List<RefPtr<ComponentType>> const& childComponents);\n   668\n   669private:\n   670    List<RefPtr<ComponentType>> m_childComponents;\n   671\n   672    // The following arrays hold the concatenated entry points, parameters,\n   673    // etc. from the child components. This approach allows for reasonably\n   674    // fast (constant time) access through operations like `getShaderParam`,\n   675    // but means that the memory usage of a composite is proportional to\n   676    // the sum of the memory usage of the children, rather than being fixed\n   677    // by the number of children (as it would be if we just stored\n   678    // `m_childComponents`).\n   679    //\n   680    // TODO: We could conceivably build some O(numChildren) arrays that\n   681    // support binary-search to provide logarithmic-time access to entry\n   682    // points, parameters, etc. while giving a better overall memory usage.\n   683    //\n   684    List<EntryPoint*> m_entryPoints;\n   685    List<String> m_entryPointMangledNames;\n   686    List<String> m_entryPointNameOverrides;\n   687    List<ShaderParamInfo> m_shaderParams;\n   688    List<SpecializationParam> m_specializationParams;\n   689    List<ComponentType*> m_requirements;\n   690\n   691    ModuleDependencyList m_moduleDependencyList;\n   692    FileDependencyList m_fileDependencyList;\n   693};\n   694\n   695/// A component type created by specializing another component type.\n   696class SpecializedComponentType : public ComponentType\n   697{\n   698public:\n   699    SpecializedComponentType(\n   700        ComponentType* base,\n   701        SpecializationInfo* specializationInfo,\n   702        List<SpecializationArg> const& specializationArgs,\n   703        DiagnosticSink* sink);\n   704\n   705    virtual void buildHash(DigestBuilder<SHA1>& builer) SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   706\n   707    /// Get the base (unspecialized) component type that is being specialized.\n   708    RefPtr<ComponentType> getBaseComponentType() { return m_base; }\n   709\n   710    RefPtr<SpecializationInfo> getSpecializationInfo() { return m_specializationInfo; }\n   711\n   712    /// Get the number of arguments supplied for existential type parameters.\n   713    ///\n   714    /// Note that the number of arguments may not match the number of parameters.\n   715    /// In particular, an unspecialized entry point may have many parameters, but zero arguments.\n   716    Index getSpecializationArgCount() { return m_specializationArgs.getCount(); }\n   717\n   718    /// Get the existential type argument (type and witness table) at `index`.\n   719    SpecializationArg const& getSpecializationArg(Index index)\n   720    {\n   721        return m_specializationArgs[index];\n   722    }\n   723\n   724    /// Get an array of all existential type arguments.\n   725    SpecializationArg const* getSpecializationArgs() { return m_specializationArgs.getBuffer(); }\n   726\n   727    Index getEntryPointCount() SLANG_OVERRIDE { return m_base->getEntryPointCount(); }\n   728    RefPtr<EntryPoint> getEntryPoint(Index index) SLANG_OVERRIDE\n   729    {\n   730        return m_base->getEntryPoint(index);\n   731    }\n   732    String getEntryPointMangledName(Index index) SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   733    String getEntryPointNameOverride(Index index) SLANG_OVERRIDE;\n   734\n   735    Index getShaderParamCount() SLANG_OVERRIDE { return m_base->getShaderParamCount(); 918};\n   919\n   920/// Describes an entry point for the purposes of layout and code generation.\n   921///\n   922/// This class also tracks any generic arguments to the entry point,\n   923/// in the case that it is a specialization of a generic entry point.\n   924///\n   925/// There is also a provision for creating a \"dummy\" entry point for\n   926/// the purposes of pass-through compilation modes. Only the\n   927/// `getName()` and `getProfile()` methods should be expected to\n   928/// return useful data on pass-through entry points.\n   929///\n   930class EntryPoint : public ComponentType, SlangPassThroughIntegral\n  1431{\n  1432    None = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_NONE,                  ///< don't pass through: use Slang compiler\n  1433    Fxc = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_FXC,                    ///< pass through HLSL to `D3DCompile` API\n  1434    Dxc = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_DXC,                    ///< pass through HLSL to `IDxcCompiler` API\n  1435    Glslang = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_GLSLANG,            ///< pass through GLSL to `glslang` library\n  1436    SpirvDis = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_SPIRV_DIS,         ///< pass through spirv-dis\n  1437    Clang = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_CLANG,                ///< Pass through clang compiler\n  1438    VisualStudio = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_VISUAL_STUDIO, ///< Visual studio compiler\n  1439    Gcc = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_GCC,                    ///< Gcc compiler\n  1440    GenericCCpp = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_GENERIC_C_CPP,  ///< Generic C/C++ compiler\n  1441    NVRTC = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_NVRTC,                ///< NVRTC CUDA compiler\n  1442    LLVM = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_LLVM,                  ///< LLVM 'compiler'\n  1443    SpirvOpt = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_SPIRV_OPT,         ///< pass thorugh spirv to spirv-opt\n  1444    MetalC = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_METAL,\n  1445    Tint = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_TINT,            ///< pass through spirv to Tint API\n  1446    SpirvLink = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_SPIRV_LINK, ///< pass through spirv to spirv-link\n  1447    CountOf = SLANG_PASS_THROUGH_COUNT_OF,\n  1448};\n  1449void printDiagnosticArg(StringBuilder& sb, PassThroughMode val);\n  1450\n  1451class SourceFile;\n  1452\n  1453/// A module.\n  1883    SHA1::Digest m_digest;\n  1884\n  1885    // List of modules this module depends on\n  1886    ModuleDependencyList m_moduleDependencyList;\n  1887\n  1888    // List of source files this module depends on\n  1889    FileDependencyList m_fileDependencyList;\n  1890\n  1891    // Entry points that were defined in this module\n  1892    //\n  1893    // Note: the entry point defined in the module are *not*\n  1894    // part of the memory image/layout of the module when\n  1895    // it is considered as an IComponentType. This can be\n  1896    // a bit confusing, but if all the entry points in the\n  1897    // module were automatically linked into the component\n  1898    // type, we'd need a way to access just the global\n  1899    // scope of the module without the entry points, in\n  1900    // case we wanted to link a single entry point against\n  1901    // the global scope. The `Module` type provides exactly\n  1902    // that \"module without its entry points\" unit of\n  1903    // granularity for linking.\n  1904    //\n  1905    // This list only exists for lookup purposes, so that\n  1906    // the user can find an existing entry-point function\n  1907    // that was defined as part of the module.\n  1908    //\n  1909    List<RefPtr<EntryPoint>> m_entryPoints;\n  1910\n  1911    // The builder that owns all of the AST nodes from parsing the source of\n  1912    // this module.\n  1913    RefPtr<ASTBuilder> m_astBuilder;\n  1914\n  1915    // Holds map of exported mangled names to symbols. m_mangledExportPool maps names to indices,\n  1916    // and m_mangledExportSymbols holds the NodeBase* values for each index.\n  1917    StringSlicePool m_mangledExportPool;\n  1918    List<Decl*> m_mangledExportSymbols;\n  1919\n  1920    // Source files that have been pulled into the module with `__include`.\n  1921    Dictionary<SourceFile*, FileDecl*> m_mapSourceFileToFileDecl;\n  1922\n  1923public:\n  1924    SLANG_NO_THROW SlangResult SLANG_MCALL disassemble(slang::IBlob** outDisassembledBlob) override\n  1925    {\n  1926        if (!outDisassembledBlob)\n  1927            return SLANG_E_INVALID_ARG;\n  1928        String disassembly;\n  1929        this->getIRModule()->getModuleInst()->dump(disassembly);\n  1930        auto blob = StringUtil::createStringBlob(disassembly);\n  1931        *outDisassembledBlob = blob.detach();\n  1932        return SLANG_OK;\n  1933    }\n  1934};\n  1935typedef Module LoadedModule;\n  1936\n  1937/// A request for the front-end to compile a translation unit.\n  1938class TranslationUnitRequest : public RefObject\n  1939{\n  1940public:\n  1941   // TypeLayouts created on the fly by reflection API\n  2101    struct TypeLayoutKey\n  2102    {\n  2103        Type* type;\n  2104        slang::LayoutRules rules;\n  2105        HashCode getHashCode() const\n  2106        {\n  2107            Hasher hasher;\n  2108            hasher.hashValue(type);\n  2109            hasher.hashValue(rules);\n  2110            return hasher.getResult();\n  2111        }\n  2112        bool operator==(TypeLayoutKey other) const\n  2113        {\n  2114            return type == other.type && rules == other.rules;\n  2115        }\n  2116    };\n  2117    Dictionary<TypeLayoutKey, RefPtr<TypeLayout>> typeLayouts;\n  2118\n  2119    Dictionary<TypeLayoutKey, RefPtr<TypeLayout>>& getTypeLayouts() { return typeLayouts; }\n  2120\n returns which (if any) intermediate source language is required\n  2139/// to produce it.\n  2140///\n  2141/// If no intermediate source language is required, will return SourceLanguage::Unknown\n  2142SourceLanguage getIntermediateSourceLanguageForTarget(TargetProgram* req);\n  2143\n  2144/// Are resource types \"bindless\" (implemented as ordinary data) on the given `target`?\n  2145bool areResourceTypesBindlessOnTarget(TargetRequest* target);\n  2146\n  2147// Compute the \"effective\" profile to use when outputting the given entry point\n  2148// for the chosen code-generation target.\n  2149//\n  2150// The stage of the effective profile will always come from the entry point, while\n  2151// the profile version (aka \"shader model\") will be computed as follows:\n  2152//\n  2153// - If the entry point and target belong to the same profile family, then take\n  2154//   the latest version between the two (e.g., if the entry point specified `ps_5_1`\n  2155//   and the target specifies `sm_5_0` then use `sm_5_1` as the version).\n  2156//\n  2157// - If the entry point and target disagree on the profile family, always use the\n  2158//   profile family and version from the target.\n  2159//\n  2160Profile getEffectiveProfile(EntryPoint* entryPoint, TargetRequest* target);\n  2161\n  2162\n  2163/// Given a target returns the required downstream compiler\n  2164PassThroughMode getDownstreamCompilerRequiredForTarget(CodeGenTarget target);\n  2165/// Given a target returns a downstream compiler the prelude should be taken from.\n  2166SourceLanguage getDefaultSourceLanguageForDownstreamCompiler(PassThroughMode compiler);\n  2167\n  2168/// Get the build tag string\n  2169const char* getBuildTagString();\n  2170\n  2171struct TypeCheckingCache;\n  2172\n  2173struct ContainerTypeKey\n  2174{\n  2175    slang::TypeReflection* elementType;\n  2176    slang::ContainerType containerType;\n  2177    bool operator==(ContainerTypeKey other) const\n  2178    {\n  2179        return elementType == other.elementType && containerType == other.containerType;\n  2180    }\n  2181    Slang::HashCode getHashCode() const\n  2182    {\n  2183        return Slang::combineHash(\n  2184            Slang::getHashCode(elementType),\n  2185            Slang::getHashCode(containerType));\n  2186    }\n  2187};\n  2188\n  2189/// A dictionary of modules to be considered when resolving `import`s,\n  2190/// beyond those that would normally be found through a `Linkage`.\n  2191///\n  2192/// Checking of an `import` declaration will bottleneck through\n  2193/// `Linkage::findOrImportModule`, which would usually just check for\n  2194/// any module that had been previously loaded into the same `Linkage`\n  2195/// (e.g., by a call to `Linkage::loadModule()`).\n  2196///\n  2197/// In the case where compilation is being done through an\n  2198/// explicit `FrontEndCompileRequest` or `EndToEndCompileRequest`,\n  2199/// the modules being compiled by that request do not get added to\n  2200/// the surrounding `Linkage`.\n  2201///\n  2202/// There is a corner case when an explicit compile request has\n  2203/// multiple `TranslationUnitRequest`s, because the user (reasonably)\n  2204/// expects that if they compile `A.slang` and `B.slang` as two\n  2205/// distinct translation units in the same compile request, then\n  2206/// an `import B` inside of `A.slang` should resolve to reference\n  2207/// the code of `B.slang`. But because neither `A` nor `B` gets\n  2208/// added to the `Linkage`, and the `Linkage` is what usually\n  2209/// determines what is or isn't loaded, that intuition will\n  2210/// be wrong, without a bit of help.\n  2211///\n  2212/// The `LoadedModuleDictionary` is thus filled in by a\n  2213/// `FrontEndCompileRequest` to collect the modules it is compiling,\n  2214/// so that they can cross-reference one another (albeit with\n  2215/// a current implementation restriction that modules in the\n  2216/// request can only `import` those earlier in the request...).\n  2217///\n  2218/// The dictionary then gets passed around between nearly all of\n  2219/// the operations that deal with loading modules, to make sure\n  2220/// that they can detect a previously loaded module.\n  2221///\n  2222typedef Dictionary<Name*, Module*> LoadedModuleDictionary;\n  2223\n  2224enum ModuleBlobType\n  2225{\n  2226    Source,\n  2227    IR\n  2228};\n  2229\n  2230/// A context for loading and re-using code modules.\n  2231class Linkage : public RefObject, public slang::ISession\n  2232{\n  2233public:\n  2234    SLANG_REF_OBJECT_IUNKNOWN_ALL\n  2235\n  2236 m_semanticsForReflection;\n  2616};\n  2617\n  2618/// Shared functionality between front- and back-end compile requests.\n  2619///\n  2620/// This is the base class for both `FrontEndCompileRequest` 2772\n  2773/// A visitor for use with `ComponentType`s, allowing dispatch over the concrete subclasses.\n  2774class ComponentTypeVisitor\n  2775{\n  2776public:\n  2777    // The following methods should be overriden in a concrete subclass\n  2778    // to customize how it acts on each of the concrete types of component.\n  2779    //\n  2780    // In cases where the application wants to simply \"recurse\" on a\n  2781    // composite, specialized, or legacy component type it can use\n  2782    // the `visitChildren` methods below.\n  2783    //\n  2784    virtual void visitEntryPoint(\n  2785        EntryPoint* entryPoint,\n  2786        EntryPoint::EntryPointSpecializationInfo* specializationInfo) = 0;\n  2787    virtual void visitModule(\n  2788        Module* module,\n  2789        Module::ModuleSpecializationInfo* specializationInfo) = 0;\n  2790    virtual void visitComposite(\n  2791        CompositeComponentType* composite,\n  2792        CompositeComponentType::CompositeSpecializationInfo* specializationInfo) = 0;\n  2793    virtual void visitSpecialized(SpecializedComponentType* specialized) = 0;\n  2794    virtual void visitTypeConformance(TypeConformance* conformance) = 0;\n  2795    virtual void visitRenamedEntryPoint(\n  2796        RenamedEntryPointComponentType* renamedEntryPoint,\n  2797 composite,\n  2806        CompositeComponentType::CompositeSpecializationInfo* specializationInfo);\n  2807    void visitChildren(SpecializedComponentType* specialized);\n  2808};\n  2809\n  2810/// A `TargetProgram` represents a `ComponentType` specialized for a particular `TargetRequest`\n  2811///\n  2812/// TODO: This should probably be renamed to `TargetComponentType`.\n  2813///\n  2814/// By binding a component type to a specific target, a `TargetProgram` allows\n  2815/// for things like layout to be computed, that fundamentally depend on\n  2816/// the choice of target.\n  2817///\n  2818/// A `TargetProgram` handles request for compiled kernel code for\n  2819/// entry point functions. In practice, kernel code can only be\n  2820/// correctly generated when the underlying `ComponentType` is \"fully linked\"\n  2821/// (has no remaining unsatisfied requirements).\n  2822///\n  2823class TargetProgram : public RefObject\n  2824{\n  2825public:\n  2826    TargetProgram(ComponentType* componentType, TargetRequest* targetReq);\n  2827\n  2828    /// Get the underlying program\n  2829    ComponentType* getProgram() { return m_program; }\n  2863    /// Get the compiled code for an entry point on the target.\n  2864    ///\n  2865    /// This routine assumes that `getOrCreateEntryPointResult`\n  2866    /// has already been called previously.\n  2867    ///\n  2868    IArtifact* getExistingEntryPointResult(Int entryPointIndex)\n  2869    {\n  2870        return m_entryPointResults[entryPointIndex];\n  2871    }\n  2872\n  2873    IArtifact* _createWholeProgramResult(\n  2874        DiagnosticSink* sink,\n  2875        EndToEndCompileRequest* endToEndReq = nullptr);\n  2876\n  2877    /// Internal helper for `getOrCreateEntryPointResult`.\n  2878    ///\n  2879    /// This is used so that command-line and API-based\n  2880    /// requests for code can bottleneck through the same place.\n  2881    ///\n  2882    /// Shouldn't be called directly by most code.\n  2883    ///\n  2884    IArtifact* _createEntryPointResult(\n  2885        Int entryPointIndex,\n  2886        DiagnosticSink* sink,\n  2887        EndToEndCompileRequest* endToEndReq = nullptr);\n  2888\n  2889    RefPtr<IRModule> getOrCreateIRModuleForLayout(DiagnosticSink* sink);\n  2890\n  2891    RefPtr<IRModule> getExistingIRModuleForLayout() { return m_irModuleForLayout; All optional capabilities need to be enumerated as part of the `CapabilitySet`\n  2937    //  system, so that they can be reasoned about uniformly across different targets\n  2938    //  and different layers of the compiler.\n  2939    //\n  2940    // 2. The front-end should be responsible for either or both of:\n  2941    //\n  2942    //   * Checking that `public` or otherwise externally-visible items (declarations/definitions)\n  2943    //     explicitly declare the capabilities they require, and that they only ever\n  2944    //     make use of items that are comatible with those required capabilities.\n  2945    //\n  2946    //   * Inferring the capabilities required by items that are not externally visible,\n  2947    //     and attaching those capabilities explicit as a modifier or other synthesized AST node.\n  2948    //\n  2949    // 3. The capabilities required by a given `ComponentType` and its entry points should be\n  2950    // explicitly know-able, and they should be something we can compare to the capabilities\n  2951    // of a code generation target *before* back-end code generation is started. We should be\n  2952    // able to issue error messages around lacking capabilities in a way the user can understand,\n  2953    // in terms of the high-level-language entities.\n  2954\n  2955public:\n  2956};\n  2957\n  2958struct RequiredLoweringPassSet\n  2959{\n  2960    bool debugInfo;\n  2961    bool resultType;\n  2962    bool optionalType;\n  2963    bool enumType;\n  2964    bool combinedTextureSamplers;\n  2965    bool reinterpret;\n  2966    bool generics;\n  2967    bool bindExistential;\n  2968    bool autodiff;\n  2969    bool derivativePyBindWrapper;\n  2970    bool bitcast;\n  2971    bool existentialTypeLayout;\n  2972    bool bindingQuery;\n  2973    bool meshOutput;\n  2974    bool higherOrderFunc;\n  2975    bool globalVaryingVar;\n  2976    bool glslSSBO;\n  2977    bool byteAddressBuffer;\n  2978    bool dynamicResource;\n  2979    bool dynamicResourceHeap;\n  2980    bool resolveVaryingInputRef;\n  2981    bool specializeStageSwitch;\n  2982    bool missingReturn;\n  2983    bool nonVectorCompositeSelect;\n  2984};\n  2985\n  2986/// A context for code generation in the compiler back-end\n  2987struct CodeGenContext\n  2988{\n  2989public:\n  2990    typedef List<Index> EntryPointIndices;\n  2991\n  2992    struct Shared\n  2993    {\n  2994    public:\n  2995        Shared(\n  2996            TargetProgram* targetProgram,\n  2997 getSourceManager() { return getLinkage()->getSourceManager(); }\n  3059\n  3060    ISlangFileSystemExt* getFileSystemExt() { return getLinkage()->getFileSystemExt(); }\n  3061\n  3062 getEntryPointIndices().getCount(); }\n  3067\n  3068    EntryPoint* getEntryPoint(Index index) { return getProgram()->getEntryPoint(index); }\n  3069\n  3070    Index getSingleEntryPointIndex()\n  3071    {\n  3072        SLANG_ASSERT(getEntryPointCount() == 1);\n  3073        return getEntryPointIndices()[0];\n  3074    }\n  3075\n  3076    //\n  3077\n  3078    IRDumpOptions getIRDumpOptions();\n  3079\n  3080    bool shouldValidateIR();\n  3081    bool shouldDumpIR();\n  3082    bool shouldReportCheckpointIntermediates();\n  3083\n  3084    bool shouldTrackLiveness();\n  3085\n  3086    bool shouldDumpIntermediates();\n  3087    String getIntermediateDumpPrefix();\n  3088\n  3089    bool getUseUnknownImageFormatAsDefault();\n  3090\n  3091    bool isSpecializationDisabled();\n  3092\n  3093    bool shouldSkipSPIRVValidation();\n  3094\n  3095    SlangResult requireTranslationUnitSourceFiles();\n  3096\n  3097    //\n  3098\n  3099    SlangResult emitEntryPoints(ComPtr<IArtifact>& outArtifact);\n  3100\n  3101    SlangResult emitPrecompiledDownstreamIR(ComPtr<IArtifact>& outArtifact);\n  3102\n  3103    void maybeDumpIntermediate(IArtifact* artifact);\n  3104\n  3105    // Used to cause instructions available in precompiled blobs to be\n  3106    // removed between IR linking and target source generation.\n  3107    bool removeAvailableInDownstreamIR = false;\n  3108\n  3109    // Determines if program level compilation like getTargetCode() or getEntryPointCode()\n  3110    // should return a fully linked downstream program or just the glue SPIR-V/DXIL that\n  3111    // imports and uses the precompiled SPIR-V/DXIL from constituent modules.\n  3112    // This is a no-op if modules are not precompiled.\n  3113    bool shouldSkipDownstreamLinking();\n  3114\n  3115    RequiredLoweringPassSet& getRequiredLoweringPassSet() { return m_requiredLoweringPassSet; }\n  3116\n  3117protected:\n  3118    CodeGenTarget m_targetFormat = CodeGenTarget::Unknown;\n  3119    Profile m_targetProfile;\n  3120    ExtensionTracker* m_extensionTracker = nullptr;\n  3121\n  3122    // To improve the performance of our backend, we will try to avoid running\n  3123    // passes related to features not used in the user code.\n  3124    // To do so, we will scan the IR module once, and determine which passes are needed\n  3125    // based on the instructions used in the IR module.\n  3126    // This will allow us to skip running passes that are not needed, without having to\n  3127    // run all the passes only to find out that no work is needed.\n  3128    // This is especially important for the performance of the backend, as some passes\n  3129    // have an initialization cost (such as building reference graphs or DOM trees) that\n  3130    // can be expensive.\n  3131    RequiredLoweringPassSet m_requiredLoweringPassSet;\n  3132\n  3133    /// Will output assembly as well as the artifact if appropriate for the artifact type for\n  3134    /// assembly output and conversion is possible\n  3135    void _dumpIntermediateMaybeWithAssembly(IArtifact* artifact);\n  3136\n  3137    void _dumpIntermediate(IArtifact* artifact);\n  3138    void _dumpIntermediate(const ArtifactDesc& desc, void const* data, size_t size);\n  3139\n  3140    /* Emits entry point source taking into account if a pass-through or not. Uses 'targetFormat' to\n  3141    determine the target (not targetReq) */\n  3142    SlangResult emitEntryPointsSource(ComPtr<IArtifact>& outArtifact);\n  3143\n  3144    SlangResult emitEntryPointsSourceFromIR(ComPtr<IArtifact>& outArtifact);\n  3145\n  3146    SlangResult emitWithDownstreamForEntryPoints(ComPtr<IArtifact>& outArtifact);\n  3147\n  3148    /* Determines a suitable filename to identify the input for a given entry point being compiled.\n  3149    If the end-to-end compile is a pass-through case, will attempt to find the (unique) source file\n  3150    pathname for the translation unit containing the entry point at `entryPointIndex.\n  3151    If the compilation is not in a pass-through case, then always returns `\"slang-generated\"`.\n  3152    @param endToEndReq The end-to-end compile request which might be using pass-through compilation\n  3153    @param entryPointIndex The index of the entry point to compute a filename for.\n  3154    @return the appropriate source filename */\n  3155    String calcSourcePathForEntryPoints();\n  3156\n  3157    TranslationUnitRequest* findPassThroughTranslationUnit(Int entryPointIndex);\n  3158\n  3159\n  3160    SlangResult _emitEntryPoints(ComPtr<IArtifact>& outArtifact);\n  3161\n  3162private:\n  3163    Shared* m_shared = nullptr;\n  3164};\n  3165\n  3166/// A compile request that spans the front and back ends of the compiler\n  3167///\n  3168/// This is what the command-line `slangc` uses, as well as the legacy\n  3169/// C API. 3527};\n  3528\n  3529/* Returns SLANG_OK if pass through support is available */\n  3530SlangResult checkExternalCompilerSupport(Session* session, PassThroughMode passThrough);\n  3531/* Report an error appearing from external compiler to the diagnostic sink error to the diagnostic\n  3532sink.\n  3533@param compilerName The name of the compiler the error came for (or nullptr if not known)\n  3534@param res Result associated with the error. */\n  3538void reportExternalCompileError(\n  3539    const char* compilerName,\n  3540    SlangResult res,\n  3541    const UnownedStringSlice& diagnostic,\n  3542    DiagnosticSink* sink);\n  3543\n  3544//\n  3545\n  3546// Information about BaseType that's useful for checking literals\n  3547struct BaseTypeInfo\n  3548{\n  3549    typedef uint8_t Flags;\n  3550    struct Flag\n  3551    {\n  3552        enum Enum : Flags\n  3553        {\n  3554            Signed = 0x1,\n  3555            FloatingPoint = 0x2,\n  3556            Integer = 0x4,\n  3557        };\n  3558    };\n  3559\n  3560    SLANG_FORCE_INLINE static const BaseTypeInfo& getInfo(BaseType baseType)\n  3561    {\n  3562        return s_info[Index(baseType)];\n  3563    }\n  3564\n  3565    static UnownedStringSlice asText(BaseType baseType);\n  3566\n  3567    uint8_t sizeInBytes; ///< Size of type in bytes\n  3568    Flags flags;\n  3569    uint8_t baseType;\n  3570\n  3571    static bool check();\n  3572\n  3573private:\n  3574    static const BaseTypeInfo s_info[Index(BaseType::CountOf)];\n  3575};\n  3576\n  3577class CodeGenTransitionMap\n  3578{\n  3579public:\n  3580    struct Pair\n  3581    {\n  3582        typedef Pair ThisType;\n  3583        SLANG_FORCE_INLINE bool operator==(const ThisType& rhs) const\n  3584        {\n  3585            return source == rhs.source && target == rhs.target;\n  3586        }\n  3587        SLANG_FORCE_INLINE bool operator!=(const ThisType& rhs) const { return !(*this == rhs); }\n  3588\n  3589        SLANG_FORCE_INLINE HashCode getHashCode() const\n  3590        {\n  3591            return combineHash(HashCode(source), HashCode(target));\n  3592        }\n  3593\n  3594        CodeGenTarget source;\n  3595        CodeGenTarget target;\n  3596    };\n  3597\n  3598    void removeTransition(CodeGenTarget source, CodeGenTarget target)\n  3599    {\n  3600        m_map.remove(Pair{source, target});\n  3601    }\n  3602    void addTransition(CodeGenTarget source, CodeGenTarget target, PassThroughMode compiler)\n  3603    {\n  3604        SLANG_ASSERT(source != target);\n  3605        m_map.set(Pair{source, target}, compiler);\n  3606    }\n  3607    bool hasTransition(CodeGenTarget source, CodeGenTarget target) const\n  3608    {\n  3609        return m_map.containsKey(Pair{source, target});\n  3610    }\n  3611    PassThroughMode getTransition(CodeGenTarget source, CodeGenTarget target) const\n  3612    {\n  3613        const Pair pair{source, target};\n  3614        auto value = m_map.tryGetValue(pair);\n  3615        return value ? *value : PassThroughMode::None;\n  3616    }\n  3617\n  3618protected:\n  3619    Dictionary<Pair, PassThroughMode> m_map;\n  3620};\n  3621\n  3622class GlobalSession :
